result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zayre Malik Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zayre Malik Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Zayre Malik Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case adjourned, Branch 15.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 11, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Zayre Malik Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci appeared by video for Zayre Malik Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Zayre Malik Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor appeared by video for Zayre Malik Johnson.  Attorney Michael J. Odden appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference. This hearing MAY be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/104d9737-ba2f-8811-9083-aed2135824d9
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
